casebody.data:
FERDINAND FOLLER, Plaintiff and Respondent, v. HENRY J. LIPPE, Defendant and Appellant.

Before Sedgwick and Freedman, JJ.

Decided June 13, 1879. *614Appeal from judgment in favor of plaintiff, entered, upon the verdict of a jury, and from an order denying defendant’s motion for a new trial. This case involves mainly questions of fact. John B. Pannes, for appellant. Simon Sultan, for respondent. Freedman, J.,

wrote for affirmance, with costs.

Sedgwick, J., concurred. ,
